alert.note: Alert for McDowell; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 10:08PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern McDowell and southwestern Wyoming Counties through 1045 PM EDT... At 1007 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Gilbert Creek, or 15 miles west of Welch, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Welch, Pineville, Northfork, Davy, Iaeger, Keystone, Kimball, Panther and Wolf Pen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for southern West Virginia.
